question: In Python, the function used to take input from the user is ________.
The input() function in Python stores user input as a ________ by default.
To convert user input to a number, you use the ________ function for integers or ________ for decimals.
If you don't convert input to numbers, Python will treat them as ________ and concatenate instead of adding.
To take multiple inputs in one line, you can use the ________ method.
The print() function in Python is used to display output on the ________.
You can print variables and calculations directly using the ________ function.
In print(), multiple items are separated by ________ by default.
To change the separator in print(), you use the ________ parameter.
To prevent print() from starting a new line, you can change the ________ parameter.
F-strings in Python are used for ________ output formatting.
